repo_url.description: The url of the git repository you'll be creating a PR for

branch_name.description: A reasonable and concise branch name for this PR

commit_message.description: The commit message to use for this PR

pr_description.description: A longer-form description body for this PR, should allow users to understand the context and implications of the change.  The expected format should include a Summary section, a Changes Made section and a Rationale section to explain the PR to reviewers.

file_updates.description: A list of files to update in this PR

items.description: An update to an individual file.  Be sure to include surrounding lines to allow us to find the appropriate block being replaced, AND leading whitespace on each line should be preserved.

file_name.description: the relative file path name for this update

replacement.description: the file content you want to write to this file, including all whitespace and line characters to the correct indentation level.

previous.description: the previous content within the file this will be replacing, including all whitespace and line characters.  Provide an empty string if you want to simply append to the file.

file_deletes.description: A list of files to delete in this PR

items.description: A file to delete in this PR

file_name.description: the relative file path name for this delete

file_creates.description: A list of files to create in this PR

items.description: A file to create in this PR

file_name.description: the relative file path name for the file to create

content.description: the full content to write to the file
